Key Match Events: Aiden Markram held his nerve to take South Africa close and they eventually got home in 47.2 overs
Usama Mir came on as a concussion substitute and got rid of Rassie van der Dussen and took a catch to dismiss Heinrich Klaasen
Haris Rauf nearly won it for Pakistan towards the end with a diving catch to send back Lungi Ngidi
Keshav Maharaj and Tabraiz Shamsi hung on to settle the tense game
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa skipper Temba Bavuma said slipping to 250-8 after looking comfortable at one stage was a problem of South Africa's own making
Pakistan team director Mickey Arthur warned against a 'witch-hunt' of his team after their World Cup dream suffered a likely fatal blow
Pakistan captain Babar Azam said they fought back but were 10 to 15 runs short and didn't finish well
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan fell to their fourth successive defeat
South Africa moved closer to securing a Cricket World Cup semifinal place with their fifth win in six matches
Others: Pakistan will have to win their remaining three matches and hope other results go their way if they are to sneak into the semifinals
